sn22.115:4.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn22.115:4.4: How is a Dharma speaker defined?”
sn22.115:4.5: “Mendicant, if a mendicant teaches Dharma for disillusionment with form, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dharma’.
sn22.115:4.6: If they practice for disillusionment with form, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who practices in line with the teaching’.
sn22.115:4.7: If they’re freed without grasping by disillusionment with form, by its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who has attained extinguishment in this very life’.
sn22.115:4.8: If a mendicant teaches Dharma for disillusionment with feeling …
sn22.115:4.11: consciousness, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dharma’.
sn22.115:4.12: If they practice for disillusionment with consciousness, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who practices in line with the teaching’.
sn22.115:4.13: If they’re freed without grasping by disillusionment with consciousness, by its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who has attained extinguishment in this very life’.”
